;;;PhD profile:;;

;

;;Fan Gang, the first doctorate in the history of Western economic thought in New China (tied with Zuo Dapei). ;

;

;;Born in Beijing in September 1953 city. ;

;

;;In 1969, went to Heilongjiang Production and Construction Corps Farming, in 1975, transferred to Weichang County, Hebei Province. ;

;

;;1978-1982, Hebei University Bachelor's degree in Economics. ;

;

;;1982-1985, Chinese society Graduate student in Western Economics at the Academy of Sciences. ;

;

;;1985-1988, Chinese society PhD candidate in Western Economics at the Academy of Sciences. ;

;

;;1985-1987, went to the United States Studied at the National Bureau of Economic Research and Harvard University. ;

;

;;In 1988, he entered China with a Ph.D. Work at the Institute of Economics, Academy of Social Sciences. ;

;

;;In 1992, he was promoted to the Chinese Society of A researcher at the Academy of Sciences, he was rated as a national-level young and middle-aged expert with outstanding contributions. ;

;

;;1994-1995, served as China Deputy Director of the Institute of Economics, Academy of Social Sciences. ;

;

;;1995-2015, served as China Chairman and legal representative of the Economic Reform Research Foundation. ;

;

;;Since 1996, he has served as the head of China’s economic system Vice president of the Reform Research Association and concurrently director of the Beijing Institute of National Economic Research. ;

;

;;2006-2010, 2015 -In 2018, he served as a member of the Central Monetary Policy Committee twice. ;

;

;;Since 2012, he has served as a national high-end think tank Vice Chairman and President of the Board of Directors of China (Shenzhen) Comprehensive Development Research Institute. ;

;

;;

;

;On August 26, 2020, Fan Gang gave a keynote speech at the World Ocean City Qingdao Forum. (Photo provided by People’s Vision)

;

;On June 18, 1968, China’s northernmost black land entered the best season of the year. A unit with the main task of “reclamation and border defense”-Heilongjiang Production Construction Corps - established.

;

;In pursuit of the goal of "reclaiming the Great Northern Wilderness", millions of urban educated youths rushed to a foreign land that was covered in frost all year round. In the vigorous tide of the times, young Fan Gang is no exception.

;

;Fan Gang was born in 1953 in an intellectual family. His parents left Shanghai after graduating from church school and went to work in Beijing. There, after Fan Gang finished primary school, the "Cultural Revolution" began and he was assigned to attend a nearby middle school. But in just the past year and a half, the general environment has changed. In 1969, Fan Gang, who had just learned a few English letters, was assigned to work in the Heilongjiang Corps as an educated youth.

;

;Logging, clearing up wasteland, and farming, it took six years in a flash.

;

;Despite being separated from the school environment, Fan Gang is still learning and thinking. Around 1974, the Heilongjiang Production and Construction Corps discussed trialling the work point system and reforming the original fixed wage system, and Fan Gang's company was selected as one of the pilots. Relying on the "Dialectical Materialism and Historical Materialism" and "Political Economics Textbooks" he had read, Fan Gang put forward his own opinions on the pilot plan and was invited to attend a meeting at the Corps headquarters.

;

;In 1975, Fan Gang was transferred to the countryside of Weichang County, Hebei Province, where his cousin lived, because he was visiting relatives and friends. There, there are only two meals a day in winter. After finishing millet porridge at 5 o'clock in the afternoon, people are starving by seven or eight o'clock.

;

;But soon, a turning point came.

;

;Less than a year after leaving the village, Fan Gang was seconded to the county cultural center to engage in mass literary and artistic creation. In 1977, Fan Gang was experiencing life in the commune iron foundry when he heard the news on the radio about the resumption of the college entrance examination. Relying on the knowledge accumulated through years of reading miscellaneous books, he stood out from more than 5.7 million candidates across the country and was admitted to the Department of Economics of Hebei University.

;

;Four years later, Fan Gang was admitted to the Graduate School of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, which had absolute authority in the field of economics at the time, and studied under Professor Zhu Shaowen, continuing to study his favorite field. Western Economics. There, Fan Gang's talent in economics was recognized again.

;

;In 1985, upon the recommendation of Dong Fucheng, then director of the Institute of Economics of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, Fan Gang was given the opportunity to study abroad, studying at the National Bureau of Economic Research and Harvard University in the United States. economics.

;

;As important as talent is Fan Gang's diligence. Mentor Zhu Shaowen once mentioned that Fan Gang worked very hard when he was studying in the United States. He often couldn't get home because he left too late, so he slept under the table in the research bureau. In 1988, Fan Gang, who returned to China after completing his studies, successfully completed his doctoral thesis, and together with his fellow student Zuo Dapei, became the first two Western economics Ph.D.s independently trained in China after the reform and opening up.

;

;After receiving his degree, Fan Gang continued to stay at the Institute of Economics of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences.

;

;His academic achievements and social influence extend far beyond the ivory tower. In the 1990s and early 21st century when China's reform and opening up set off huge waves, Fan Gang was a representative of young scholars in the economics community. At the age of 38, he won the Sun Yefang Economic Science Award, the highest award in domestic economics research; at the age of 39, he was promoted to the Academy of Social Sciences. Researcher; at the age of 40, he became one of the youngest doctoral supervisors in the Chinese social science community; in addition to academic work, he was twice appointed by the State Council as a member of the Central Bank's Monetary Policy Committee.

;

;For his contributions and achievements in the field of transition economics, Fan Gang won the highest award in the domestic economic theory circle, the "China Economic Theory Innovation Award."

;

;However, along with the honor and cheers, there are also doubts from the outside world. In 2018, during an interview with the media, Fan Gang was pushed into the limelight because of his view of "emptying 6 wallets to buy a house." When asked about this view again two years later, Fan Gang responded that it was intended to express that houses were too expensive for young people to afford, rather than to encourage young people to "gnaw at their old age." However, if he hadn't been asked again, he "couldn't remember it" himself.

;

;On November 2, 2023, Southern Weekend reporters met this 70-year-old scholar who is still energetic. Perhaps as a result of studying economics for many years, Fan Gang has a consistent determination, as if all the great changes of the times are just pebbles thrown into the lake to him, and all he wants is to "hope that China will do well."

;

;Only debate is exciting

;

;; ;Southern Weekend;;:;; When the college entrance examination was resumed in 1977, you were admitted to the Department of Economics of Hebei University. Why did you choose this major?

;

;;Fan Gang:;I went to the countryside in Heilongjiang Production and Construction Corps in 1969. The books I read at that time were all related to Marxism-Leninism, philosophy, political economics, and scientific socialism. After a lot of study, I found that I was more interested in political economics.
;At that time, we also faced practical problems, which made people think. At that time, a company of the Construction Corps could still make a profit by farming with just 20 people. However, when more than 100 of us educated youths left, the cost increased and we actually lost money. It is said that labor creates value, how should we understand it now? At the same time, everyone is trying to change the status quo, which makes me more interested in economic issues.

;

;In addition to reading theoretical books, I was also interested in literature. At that time, everyone wanted to be a literary and artistic young man, so I also worked hard on writing. Later, I also engaged in creation at the county cultural center and wrote some folk art programs. But literary creation relies on perceptual thinking. At that time, I thought that this aspect was not my real interest, because I was not good at telling stories and I was not motivated to tell them. What's the excitement, the theoretical debate, I get excited as soon as the debate starts.

;

;The college entrance examination was resumed in 1977, and everyone could apply for three choices. I applied for economics in all of them, but not literature.

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;;You once mentioned that you are still When you went to the countryside in Heilongjiang, you once made suggestions for the reform of the work-point system, but they were not adopted. Did this experience dampen your enthusiasm for economics?

;

;;Fan Gang:;I don’t feel frustrated or unhappy. At that time, the Corps headquarters was discussing whether to change fixed wages to a work-point system, and our company was selected as the pilot. Because I had learned a little bit about political economics, I wrote a paper with my ideas, and the company instructor handed it to me. Later, the Corps invited the two of us to attend a seminar at the Corps headquarters in Jiamusi. It could be said to be my first seminar on economic issues. It was a pleasure for me to participate in the discussion.

;

;At that time, I was indeed very interested in theoretical research. Although I was not a professional and had no education, my interest was still very important. In the evening, everyone We all went to bed, and I was reading and writing alone under the oil lamp.

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;;When the college entrance examination was resumed in 1977, you Is the economics major you want to study highly competitive?

;

;;Fan Gang:; At that time, there were very few subjects and very few enrollments. For the political economics major, Peking University has one enrollment quota in Hebei Province, Jilin University has only one in Hebei, and the others are Hebei University.
;Before I went to the countryside, I was only a primary school graduate and never went to middle school. When I knew that I was going to take the college entrance examination, I only had a little over two months of review time left. Fortunately, I never stopped reading in those years, and I could find all the books I could find. I read them all, so I relied on the "foundation" of reading miscellaneous books in literature, history and philosophy at that time, and I learned mathematics in those two months. There were a total of 8 textbooks in middle school. I studied a little more than 7, and finally scored more than 60 points in the test. Attended Hebei University. Now that I think about it, the whole review process was not easy, and I grasped the last straw.

;

;;;Southern Weekend;;：;; You once mentioned that most of the university courses during your studies were classical economics. When did you first come into contact with modern economics?
;;Fan Gang:;I always say that we are a relatively lucky generation. When we first went to college in 1978, China’s economy was at its lowest point, with per capita income and economic growth rate very low. The Third Plenary Session of the First Central Committee was held, and the concept of reform gradually took shape. But in fact, what everyone was more familiar with at that time was the Soviet-style political economics. The modern economic theoretical system was not systematically taught in various universities. Only Professor Jiang Guangyuan, the department chair of Hebei University, did this.

;

;Professor Jiang graduated from Peking University with a master's degree in economics in the 1950s. He studied Western economics in his early years. During the ten years of turmoil, a group of them were decentralized and later transferred to support Hebei University. When I was a senior in college, when other schools were still teaching the "school" of Western economics, he gave us a textbook on the principles of modern economics in a systematic way.

;

;It is also because this course allows us to master modern economics more systematically, so that we can realize that in those years when we were isolated from the world, modern economic theory It has become very complicated and needs to be remedied quickly. Only in this way can we talk to the world and know in which direction the theory should develop. So later I went to the Academy of Social Sciences for graduate school, and chose the history of Western economic thought as a major, and continued along this path.

;

;;

;

;Fan Gang’s doctoral degree certificate. (Photo courtesy of interviewee)

;

;"We must not forget those who sit on the bench"

;

; ;;Southern Weekend:;;Professor Zhu Shaowen was your supervisor when you were studying for your master's degree and doctoral degree. What influence did he have on you when you were studying?

;

;;Fan Gang:;Professor Zhu’s guidance mainly focused on learning and thinking methods. He emphasized the need to read the original works and lay down a solid foundation in basic theory. , forcing us to read many original English works.

;

;;;Southern Weekend: ;; What is your relationship with Professor Zhu over the years? Master and apprentice are like father and son. What kind of person do you think he is?

;

;;Fan Gang:;;Professor Zhu is a very persistent person. In a certain sense, it can be said to be a bit stubborn, very persistent, Very stubborn. He sticks to his point of view, no matter what others say. After the reform and opening up, when everyone stopped talking about Marxist economic theory, Mr. Zhu still talked about it. ;

;

;Decades ago, he admired the views of List, the originator of German development economics. At that time, List believed that Germany was relatively backward and could not Economic measures adopted by developed countries must be adopted immediately, and there must be protection and certain government controls. Later, Japan learned from Germany, and Professor Zhu introduced these theories to China when he was studying at the University of Tokyo. But Professor Zhu's views were not recognized at that time, but now facts have proven that thanks to some unique industrial policies, our economy can develop.

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;; Development economics advocated by Professor Zhu The point of view has also been inherited by you.

;

;;Fan Gang:; Some. To be honest, when the country was first opened, we paid more attention to the market economy itself. We were preoccupied with studying why other countries were so efficient and developed so advancedly, and we wanted to learn from Western systems to develop ourselves. At that time, before Western countries and we had reached the stage of competition, we were developing labor-intensive industries, and academic research was mainly concentrated in the field of institutional economics.

;

;It was not until the new century that we began to have some development competition with developed countries that we began to think more about development economics. After 2010, I started teaching development economics to graduate students at Peking University.

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;;Except for Professor Zhu, the past twenty During your years of study and research, are there any teachers whose teachings have had a greater impact on you?

;

;;Fan Gang:;This is a long story. One was Dong Fucheng, the then director of the institute. I once said in a commemorative article that I was able to study abroad because Director Dong gave me the only indicator. He felt that I had a foundation in foreign languages ​​​​and Western economics and could make good use of this opportunity, even though I was still young at the time. Not from the place.

;

;The second person who had a great influence on me was Liu Guoguang, the then vice president of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences. He advocated reform. In the late 1980s and early 1990s, with his approval, we were able to set up a research group and write the book "Outline of Macroeconomic Theory of Public Ownership". Although some of the views in this book were unclear at the time. Not entirely consistent with his views.

;

;There is also Professor Zhang Shuguang, who is now 84 years old. He is both my collaborator and my predecessor. He was the deputy chief author of the "Outline of Macroeconomic Theory of Public Ownership". Compared to me, the main writer, he has personally experienced the era of planned economy and many early research experiences, and is more familiar with the reality of China. When writing the book, I had many in-depth exchanges with him, and the theoretical system of the book was also constructed by us together.

;

;There are also some old gentlemen who, although I have not had much contact with them, left a deep impression on me, such as Wu Baosan. He returned from studying economics at Harvard and advocated using more scientific methods to analyze China's economic history. When he studied history, he not only saw the historical facts, but also saw the economic logic within it. In order to do research, he spent a lot of effort. Even during the "Cultural Revolution", he still wrote a lot of things in his study, which was not easy.

;

;From today's perspective, they have been sitting on the bench for many years and have contributed to the basic project of Chinese economics. Don't forget them.

;

;Consensus is "balance"

;

;;;Southern Weekend;;: ;;During your PhD studies, you went to study in the United States and came up with the idea of ​​using modern economics theory to explain China’s problems. How could you come up with such an idea if you are not at the center of the reform trend?

;

;;Fan Gang:;After all, I had been studying economics for nearly ten years before going abroad, and at the same time, I was studying China's economic issues. In addition, after graduating from elementary school, I first stayed in the Heilongjiang Corps for six years, and then stayed in rural Hebei for two years. I had a real sense of poverty in rural areas, and also a real sense of China's economic problems. I have personally seen people in a state where they don’t have enough to eat. I still remember one time when I went to a house in the village. A middle-aged man was lying on the kang. I asked him why he didn't go to work. He said that there was some food for my son to eat at noon. If he went to the fields, I couldn't go there. .

;

;After I went abroad and learned more things, I felt that I began to "integrate" theoretical and practical issues. The knowledge accumulated in the first 10 years of studying economics, Coupled with constant thinking about practical problems, I feel that I can better explain China's economic problems. I feel that I can do a lot of things, and these things are not what I can do abroad. I must do it with everyone at home. I did it, so I insisted on returning to China.

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;; Regarding the Chinese economic theory at that time, Do you have any clear ideas or plans for renovation?

;

;;Fan Gang:; There is no systematic plan, I just feel that there is a need for systematic understanding and change. For example, at that time, there was an endless debate in China about which was the truth, Marxist political economics or modern economics. When I was writing my doctoral thesis, I gradually realized that any theory is a process of continuous innovation and synthesis. Different theories The theories will gradually integrate and learn from each other's strengths, so I wrote my doctoral thesis "Comparison and Synthesis of the Three Major Modern Economic Theoretical Systems". The purpose at that time was that no matter what others said, I figured it out myself. From now on, if I encounter this kind of problem again, I won’t be entangled or come back to it again and again. My point of view is in this book. I don’t have to discuss it over and over again, so I can be free to study real economic issues.

;

;So in the first ten years after I came back, I wrote several big books with millions of words, as well as some papers and essays. After finishing them, I felt It's easier. Not only do you no longer need to worry about some issues, but your theoretical views will also be more consistent, and you won't have to do this now, then that, and always have to revise and correct yourself later.

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;;When I graduated with my Ph.D., the school had Are you saying that you are the first doctorate majoring in the history of Western economic thought?

;

;;Fan Gang:;Everyone may know that I am the first doctorate in this major, but in fact, Mr. Zhu led a total of I have obtained three master's degrees and two doctorates. I graduated with Zuo Dapei. You can say that I am the first, and you can also say that Zuo Dapei is the first. When we graduated, we didn’t have doctoral hats or gowns, so there was no sense of ceremony.

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;;During his doctoral studies, Professor Zhu did not You were allowed to participate in social discussions too early, so you only embarked on the path of "managing the world for practical use" after graduating from your Ph.D. What goals did you have at that time?

;

;;Fan Gang:;I got the associate senior professional title two years after I graduated with a Ph.D., and passed French and English in the third year. After passing the foreign language exam and publishing works on a certain scale, I was promoted to full professor under the exception, and all the professional title matters were completed around the age of 40. For me personally, I don’t want to be an official or do business. I really don’t have any specific goals. All I want to do is write something that can have an impact on others and contribute to the development of a discipline. However, I have also done some administrative work in recent years, including being responsible for two or three research institutions and fulfilling some social responsibilities.

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;;In 2006, you became the central bank currency Member of the Policy Committee and served two terms thereafter. During this period, a series of problems such as the 2008 global economic crisis occurred one after another. Do you have any special observations during this tenure?

;

;;Fan Gang;: It is very beneficial to participate in some discussions at this level. You can observe closely how various ministries and commissions consider issues. From different angles, we can enhance our understanding of the so-called interest subjects. Different ministries and commissions are responsible for different things. They not only represent the overall interests of the country, but also represent different interest groups and have different perspectives. During the discussion, the people sitting in the room, that is, representatives of various ministries and commissions, will bring their own issues and perspectives to the decision-making circle. Everyone will speak out and explain these issues clearly. The consensus reached in this way will be To a certain extent, it is what is called "equilibrium" in economics.

;

;"Goals should not be specific to things like position and money"

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;; Judging from the papers you published, you have many academic opinions that directly point to institutional issues. It seems that you are not a "pacified" scholar-official in the traditional Confucian concept. Image, is this a common trait among economists or is it just your personality?

;

;;Fan Gang:; There are also people who are more radical than me. One reason is that after the reform and opening up, there was a better environment, everyone spoke more openly, and the problems we faced at that time were more realistic and acute.

;

;But I don’t want to do anything to impress people. If I talk about a certain problem, the premise is that in my opinion, the problem really exists, and I I don’t want to turn a 3-point question into a 5-point or 10-point question. Although sometimes it may seem that what I say is harsh, the purpose is still to put forward some constructive ideas. The ultimate goal is to solve the problem. This is the bottom line that I have always adhered to. I hope China is good, and I hope China can continue to develop.

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;;Analysis of China’s economy over the years Did you have any conflicts with others during the discussion?

;

;;Fan Gang:;There are always some differences in opinions, and there are even some deeper differences, but in most cases over the years, I have I don’t argue with others. I always feel that I just need to explain my point of view well. Whether others accept it or not is their business. You don’t have to think about convincing anyone. This will consume a lot of energy and is meaningless.

;

;However, in early February this year, I published an article in "Management World" in which I put forward my different opinions on the comparative advantage point of view emphasized by Professor Lin Yifu. view. The so-called comparative advantage generally means that a backward country should make good use of its advantage of lower costs of certain production factors.

;

;My basic point is that comparative advantage is only important in the early stages of our economic development, that is, before and after joining the WTO and before the wages of migrant workers skyrocketed. . When we enter the middle-income stage, comparative advantages gradually decline. What is really important at this time is the "latecomer advantage", that is, through opening up to the outside world, learning, introduction, digestion, and absorption, and learning more as quickly as possible at a lower cost. Knowledge and technology allow this knowledge to play a role in our country and realize the spillover of knowledge elements. Our development has not only introduced advanced technology and equipment from the beginning, giving full play to our late-mover advantage. Our growth in the past two decades has mainly relied on various knowledge and technologies learned after the opening up, and we have gradually learned the ability to innovate. . Now the Americans are trying to curb our development. They use various means of containment, such as decoupling, cutting off supplies, stopping academic exchanges, restricting overseas students, etc., all of which are to prevent us from exerting our latecomer advantage. They don't care at all about your comparative advantage, because your comparative advantage is only the cost advantage of some "primary factors" and can only engage in some labor-intensive industries that they don't care about. What they are really afraid of is how we can quickly use our latecomer advantages to Increasing the "high-quality elements" of knowledge and technology has caused them to lose their comparative advantage in this regard.

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;;You mentioned in your autobiography, While visiting Harvard University, I was very impressed by their graduate training methods. After returning to China, I tried it in the graduate school. What adjustments did you make at that time?

;

;;Fan Gang:; Harvard graduate students have to take two years of classes and pass a qualifying exam before they can start writing a thesis. When graduate students take classes, they do not use textbooks, but directly teach papers. Even if they were just published yesterday, as long as everyone thinks they are valuable, the textbooks are only used for reference.

;

;When I returned to China, I felt that China’s graduate education needed to be improved, so I applied for a grant and invited PhD students who had just returned to China or had obtained degrees abroad to For example, Hai Wen, Zhang Weiying and others gave lectures to graduate students in the Academy of Social Sciences, and I myself also gave lectures for two semesters to improve the knowledge level of the graduate school in the Department of Economics.

;

;;;Southern Weekend:;;For today’s young people, especially Do you have any life advice for college students and graduate students?

;

;;Fan Gang:;I have never allowed myself to be a "youth mentor", so I don't have any life advice. My "suggestion" to myself is that the goal should not be specific to things like position and money, but should think more about how to make something decent and provide my own contribution in order to gain social recognition. From a life perspective, this is true satisfaction.

;Recently, a blogger claimed that the two concerts of the well-known pop rock band "Mayday" in Shanghai and London were criticized. The audio was identified and it was found that many tracks contained lip-synching, which aroused widespread concern. This year's "Mayday" also performed many times at Beijing's Bird's Nest. On December 3, a reporter from Nandu called the Beijing Cultural Market Comprehensive Law Enforcement Corps. The staff said that they were aware of the discussion on the Internet and would pay close attention to it in the future.

;

;;

;

;Bloggers' identification of "real and fake singing" at the "Mayday" concert sparked widespread discussion.

;

;From the end of November to the beginning of December, the blogger "Wheatfield Farmer" used professional software to "analyze" the audio recordings of Mayday's two concerts in Shanghai and London, and believed that many of the tracks were lip-synced. Or some passages were lip-synced, causing widespread concern. In this regard, the local management departments of "Mayday" and related concerts have not yet responded.

;

;This year, "Mayday" also held several consecutive large-scale concerts at the National Stadium (Bird's Nest). On December 3, Nandu reporters contacted the Beijing Cultural Market Comprehensive Law Enforcement Corps. Staff said that currently, It is not yet certain whether the "Mayday" Beijing performance will be lip-syncing, but we will keep a close eye on it in the future.

;

;The above-mentioned staff introduced to Nandu reporters that Article 28 of the current "Regulations on the Administration of Commercial Performances" stipulates that "actors shall not deceive the audience by lip-syncing, and the performance organizer shall not organize actors to lip-sync. Any unit Or an individual may not provide conditions for lip-synching." "Implementation Rules of the Commercial Performance Management Regulations" clearly states: "Lip-syncing refers to the act of actors using pre-recorded songs instead of live singing during the performance."

; < p>; Regarding the basic situation of the actors' singing process, the "Detailed Rules" also stipulates that the performance organizer should send a dedicated person to supervise the singing behavior and make records for future reference. The record must be signed and confirmed by the person in charge of the performance organization and the supervisor. If netizens have relevant information and evidence, they can report it to the government management department corresponding to the concert. The reporting hotline in Beijing is 010-12345.
